Palo_Alto.Searsville, California:
Searsville (c.1854–1891) was a former town that sat in present-day Searsville Lake, Woodside, San Mateo County, California. At Northwest Corner Sandhill Road and Portola Road is a plaque and this location is a California Historical Landmark in San Mateo County, since 1950.


== History ==
Charles Brown, a former whaler from San Francisco purchased a portion of the Rancho Cañada de Raymundo Mexican-era land grant of John Coppinger and settled there with his wife.
